question: How do payments work on Shakers?
ideal_answer: Shakers uses an escrow system: the client deposits funds when posting a project. Once the freelancer delivers and the client approves the work, the funds are released. If a dispute arises, Shakers Support mediates and can issue refunds.

question: What payment methods are accepted on Shakers?
ideal_answer: Shakers accepts major credit and debit cards (Visa, MasterCard, Amex), PayPal, and — for larger projects — bank transfers. Crypto payments (BTC, ETH) are optional and subject to exchange-rate locking at project start.

question: What is a freelancer on Shakers?
ideal_answer: A freelancer is a self-employed professional who registers on Shakers by completing a profile with skills, experience, and portfolio, then browses and bids on projects that match their expertise.

question: How do I find the right freelancer for my project?
ideal_answer: Use the platform’s search filters (skill, experience level, rate) or post a project and review bids. You can view freelancer profiles, ratings, past work, and directly message candidates before hiring.

question: How do I post a new project?
ideal_answer: Go to Dashboard → Post a Project. Enter a clear title, detailed description, budget or hourly rate, required skills and milestones. Review and submit; freelancers will then send you proposals.

question: How should I set up my client profile on Shakers?
ideal_answer: Complete your profile by uploading a logo or photo, adding a company bio, specifying your industry, and filling in your contact details under Profile Setup. This builds trust with freelancers.

question: How can I communicate securely with freelancers?
ideal_answer: Use Shakers’ built-in messaging system (Communication & Messaging). Messages are encrypted end-to-end and comply with the platform’s privacy policy to keep your data safe.
